Topic.Title: Did Yahoo Begin Their $3 billion Buyback?

Message.Msg: Yahoo announced a $3 billion buyback in 2010 after their old buyback ran out and a new $5 billion buyback in May 2012. Yahoo has spent a few billion on buybacks since the 2010 announcement and that continues. Yahoo started buying under their current $5 billion buyback plan 6 months ago. Yahoo had a buyback plan in place when Yahoo hit $18 in 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011 and now in 2012. Just like they had a buyback plan in place when Yahoo hit the 14s in 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012.

Topic.Title: I knew I shouldnt of gotten yahoo web hosting. My domain name doesnt even come up/.

Message.Msg: If you really want a website try Go Daddy. I can highly recomend it. Easy to use, the service is great and if you need to chat with service they are always available. My site is what ever i want it to be. Great stuff. And i have the very best that it offered. I have a 4G site / 1000 web pages complete plus Email. I did look at Yahoo first, but with Go Daddy there was just no comparison. Go Daddy is dropping their site analytics but they are refunding the cost. Plus they are offering another group to handle analytics for you if you wish. There is nothing you need for a website they do not offer. Navigation is great, etc. Domains are secure. Hosting is great. I highly recommend it. And i shopped a dozen of their competitors as well as visited their complex. Cost is a tad expensive, about $500. But well worth it.

I see Fiscal Cliff like Y2K, expired, but they have a year for Congress to negotiate and get a new tax plan.
